story.book.view

Class StoryFragmentEditActivity

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.app.Activity
      • android.support.v4.app.FragmentActivity
        • story.book.view.StoryFragmentEditActivity
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RequestingActivity, StoryView<StoryFragment>

    public class StoryFragmentEditActivity
extends android.support.v4.app.FragmentActivity
implements StoryView<StoryFragment>, RequestingActivity
    StoryFragmentEditActivity is the interface users can make changes to illustrations contained in the story fragment which is currently open. All text illustrations displayed dynamically as EditTexts. All decision branches are displayed as buttons. Remove illustrations or branches by long pressing and selecting the corresponding option from the context menu.
    Author:
    Jessica Surya, Vina Nguyen

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private void addNewTextIllustration(View v)
      addNewTextIllustration() creates a new EditText for users to enter the text for a TextIllustration.
      private void displayFragment()
      displayFragments() displays all text illustrations as views and decision branches as buttons by getting them from the containing fragment with loadFragmentContents() and formatting them by calling formatView and formatButton respectively.
      private java.util.ArrayList<Button> formatButton(java.util.ArrayList<DecisionBranch> db, Context c)
      formatButton() creates a button with the corresponding decision branch text for each decision branch in an array list of decision branches.
      private void formatView(java.util.ArrayList<View> v)
      formatView() (FOR TEXTVIEWS ONLY) formats illustration textViews in an array list by changing: - text size (20) - text color (black) - padding on the left side
      private void loadFragmentContents()
      loadFragmentContents() loads illustration views from a saved story fragment

      • displayFragment

        private void displayFragment()
        displayFragments() displays all text illustrations as views and decision branches as buttons by getting them from the containing fragment with loadFragmentContents() and formatting them by calling formatView and formatButton respectively. Used for updating all views in the activity. http://stackoverflow.com/questions/6583019/dynamic-textview-in-relative-layout http://stackoverflow.com/questions/3995215/add-and-remove-views-in-android-dynamically

      • formatView

        private void formatView(java.util.ArrayList<View> v)
        formatView() (FOR TEXTVIEWS ONLY) formats illustration textViews in an array list by changing: - text size (20) - text color (black) - padding on the left side
        Parameters:
        View - illustrations displayed as Views

      • formatButton

        private java.util.ArrayList<Button> formatButton(java.util.ArrayList<DecisionBranch> db,
                                       Context c)
        formatButton() creates a button with the corresponding decision branch text for each decision branch in an array list of decision branches. This returns method an array list of buttons.
        Parameters:
        DecisionBranch - the decision branches associated with the fragment
        Context - the context where the button will be displayed
        Returns:
        an custom ArrayList
